description: The alert sent when a user connection event occurs.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventUsername s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventType s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventPortNumber i 9999 OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventPortLabel s EXAMPLE

description: The user pertaining to the connection event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventUsername

description: The type of connection event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventType

description: Serial port number on which this connection applies
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventPortNumber

description: The label for the serial port where the connection
occurred.
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogconnEventPortLabel

description: The alert sent when a signal change occurs

event.Summary: $v1 signal state changed to $v2 on port $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventType s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventState s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventPortNumber i 9999 OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventPortLabel s EXAMPLE

description: The particular signal which changed
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventType

description: The current signal state
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventState

description: Serial port number on which this signal applies
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventPortNumber

description: The label for the serial port where the signal applies.
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsgnlEventPortLabel

description: The alert sent when a pre-defined pattern was
matched text in a consoles serial character stream
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventDescription s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventText s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventPortNumber i 9999 OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventPortLabel s EXAMPLE

description: A description of the matches purpose
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventDescription

description: The full text which matched the pattern
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventText

description: Serial port number on which the pattern matched
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventPortNumber

description: The label for the serial port where pattern match
occurred
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogpatnEventPortLabel

description: The trap sent when a sensor event occurs

event.Summary: $v3 sensor event on device $v1 of type $v2; sensor value: $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusName s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusDevType s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusType s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusValue i 9999

description: The name of the device pertaining to the status event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusName

description: The type of device pertaining to the status event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusDevType

description: The type of sensor pertaining to the status event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusType

description: The value of the sensor pertaining to the status event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogsensStatusValue

description: The alert sent when a user connection event occurs
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventUsername s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventType s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventAddress s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventDescription s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventProtocol s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventPort i 9999

description: The user pertaining to the connection event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventUsername

description: The type of connection event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventType

description: The address of the host to which this connection applies.
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventAddress

description: The description of the host to which this connection applies.
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventDescription

description: The internet protocl to which this connection applies.
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventProtocol

description: The applicable port number of the host.
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::oghostEventPort

description: The alert sent when a network failover event occurs

event.Summary: Failover : Primary network interface $v1 failed; Secondary network interface $v2 connected

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ogfovrEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ogfovrEventPrimary s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogfovrEventSecondary s EXAMPLE

description: The name of the network interface which failed
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogfovrEventPrimary

description: The name of the network interface which was connected
instead
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogfovrEventSecondary

description: The alert sent when a UPS status event occurs
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ognupsEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ognupsEventName s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ognupsEventType s EXAMPLE

description: The name of the UPS pertaining to the status event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ognupsEventName

description: The type of status event
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ognupsEventType

description: The trap sent when a data usage alert occurs

Summary.eval: ($v4==1) ? 'Data usage exceeded $v1 bytes for $v2 seconds' : 'Data usage is normal'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventOccurred OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventBytes i 9999 OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventSeconds i 9999 OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventDevice s EXAMPLE OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventState i 9999

description: The amount of bytes which triggers this usage alert
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventBytes

description: The time in seconds over which bytes are measured
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventSeconds

description: The ID for the interface thos pertains to
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventDevice

description: Whether data usage alert is on (1) or off (0)
variables.name: OGTRAP-MIB::ogdataEventState
